body:
@gaycuttlefish @yifton @caution I've gotten way better at finding content to post, but here's the problem: I *still* can't think of any titles.

For example, one of the most recent posts was "fluffy roll". It made sense, and honestly made the whole post 10x better. But I haven't been able to do that, scrolling through every one of these images the only titles I can come up is describing exactly what I see: https://twitter.com/hourlyFox

So how are you doing it? I could sit there for an hour and never figure out anything, while most of you just think of something super creative no sweat. What's going on here?

Just so you know, I'm a much more experienced person asking for advice from people doing this as beginners, and probably not even intentionally. This is pretty much my life for ya.

So how are you doing it? I could sit there for an hour and never figure out anything, while most of you just think of something super creative no sweat. What's going on here?

Just so you know, I'm a much more experienced person asking for advice from people doing this as beginners, and probably not even intentionally. This is pretty much my life for ya.

body:
Ive been doing mine the same way most of the time, i just describe the things that catch my eye on the pics or things i think are the most cute.

Or if theyre lesser known fox types like swift fox or tibetan sand fox ill put that in the title to let anyone who will see it know the type of fox.

author.bio: god, what a bad run this site was.
author.bio_html: god, what a bad run this site was.

body:
In my "fluffy roll" post, I sat for a couple minutes thinking what the title would be (and gave up), ultimately I just described the picture. The fox is fluffy; adjective (adverb). The fox is rolling; roll. Put them together, and you got fluffy roll. I'm not good at coming up with titles, I mean, I titled a post "the fox is standing" for heaven's sake. You can also think how you would describe the picture in a conversation.

Describing the picture when you can't come up with a title is perfectly fine, and something I think most people resort to ♥
